channel.title: So how does it know where to connect to?
channel.description:
I'm using the "davidscape" server (not mine). and to play the game im using "cameronscape and butterscape rules 508 ip changer"
Now, i've got a no-ip server, "deathRS.servergame.com" ,and i download the DUC v2.2.1 and linked it to my account and check the box next to my host. Im not an idiot, i know how to port forward, i port forwarded the required port.
But when i start david scape everythings fine, then i go to the client and when i start it it asks which ip the server is on that i want to connect to. If i type "deathrs.servergame.com" it doesnt load If i type "127.0.0.1" (my own pc), it does load.
So my question is how does the server know where to be hosted from? coz there arent any config files are there? or is it just me having to connect to my own server using 127.0.0.1 and other users should be able to connect using my no-ip address. [br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 03, 2009, 07:55:37 pm[/size][hr]and to see if my server works could someone please try to connect to deathrs.servegame.com Its a 508 server

I’m using the “davidscape” server (not mine). and to play the game im using “cameronscape and butterscape rules 508 ip changer”

Now, i’ve got a no-ip server, “deathRS.servergame.com” ,and i download the DUC v2.2.1 and linked it to my account and check the box next to my host.
Im not an idiot, i know how to port forward, i port forwarded the required port.

But when i start david scape everythings fine, then i go to the client and when i start it it asks which ip the server is on that i want to connect to.
If i type “deathrs.servergame.com” it doesnt load
If i type “127.0.0.1” (my own pc), it does load.

So my question is how does the server know where to be hosted from? coz there arent any config files are there?
or is it just me having to connect to my own server using 127.0.0.1 and other users should be able to connect using my no-ip address.
